definition: this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: These days, a unit test can mean anything.
sentences.chinese: 這年頭，單元測試能代表一切。

sentences.english: There are always records. Everyone has records these days.
sentences.chinese: 這肯定有檔案，這年頭每個人都該有檔案的。

sentences.english: B： Criminals are really sneaky these days.
sentences.chinese: 這年頭的罪犯還真是狡猾。

sentences.english: Supporting a family is becoming more and more difficult these days.
sentences.chinese: 這年頭要扶養一個家庭越來越不容易了。

sentences.english: In these years, there were too many scammers.
sentences.chinese: 這年頭，各色騙子太多了。

sentences.english: Those vamps got hijacked by a lot of soft-focus romance.
sentences.chinese: 這年頭那些吸血鬼啊，都被柔和的愛情小說給劫持了。

sentences.english: Chickens were beginning to sound like the ideal pet.
sentences.chinese: 這年頭，雞正開始顯得像人們理想的崇物了。

sentences.english: Who has only one e-mail address these days?
sentences.chinese: 這年頭誰還只有一個電子郵箱地址呢？

sentences.english: One must be so careful these days.
sentences.chinese: 這年頭人得萬事小心呵。

sentences.english: You must go into trade if you want to make money nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 這年頭要想弄錢，得去做生意。

sentences.english: I think pop music is too cheezy nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得這年頭流行音樂太多了。
